sen.j: 松本金太郎（まつもと きんたろう、）シテ方宝生流能楽師。
sen.e: Kintaro MATSUMOTO was Nohgakushi (Noh actor), shite-kata Hosho-ryu (main roles of Hosho school).
Kintaro MATSUMOTO was a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing shite (the principal roles) of Hosho-ryu school.
Kintaro MATSUMOTO was a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing shite (the principal roles) of Hosho-ryu school.
He was a leading disciple of Kuro Tomoharu HOSHO.
He was a leading disciple of Kuro Tomoharu HOSHO.
He was a leading disciple of Kuro Tomoharu HOSHO.

sen.j: 葛野流大鼓方中田万三郎の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of Manzaburo NAKATA, Kadono-ryu Otsuzumi kata (large hand drum player of the Kadono school).
He was the second son of Manzaburo NAKATA, Otsuzumi kata (large hand drum player) of Kadono-ryu school.
He was the second son of Manzaburo NAKATA, Otsuzumi kata (large hand drum player) of Kadono-ryu school.

sen.j: 宝生流シテ方の松本家に養子に入る。
sen.e: He was adopted by the Matsumoto family, Hosho-ryu shite-kata (main roles of Hosho school).
He was adopted by the Matsumoto family, shite-kata (actor of the principal roles) of Hosho-ryu school.
He was adopted by the Matsumoto family, shite-kata (actor of the principal roles) of Hosho-ryu school.

sen.j: 宝生九郎知栄を支え、明治期の宝生流を復興した重鎮。
sen.e: He was a leading figure who supported Kuro Tomoharu HOSHO and restored Hosho-ryu (Hosho school) of the Meiji Period.
He was a leading figure who supported Kuro Tomoharu HOSHO and restored Hosho-ryu school of the Meiji period.
He was a leading figure who supported Kuro Tomoharu HOSHO and restored Hosho-ryu school of the Meiji period.

sen.j: 晩年の徳川慶喜に謡曲を指南。
sen.e: He instructed Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA in his later years in Yokyoku (Noh song).
He instructed Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA in his later years in Yokyoku (Noh song).
He instructed Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA in his later years in Yokyoku (Noh song).
His second son was Nagashi MATSUMOTO.
His second son was Nagashi MATSUMOTO.
His second son was Nagashi MATSUMOTO.
His grandchild was Shigeo MATSUMOTO.
Shigeo MATSUMOTO was his grandchild.
Shigeo MATSUMOTO was his grandchild.

sen.j: 泉鏡花は甥（妹・鈴の子）。
sen.e: His nephew was Kyoka IZUMI (a child of his younger sister Suzu).
His nephew was Kyoka IZUMI (a child of his younger sister Suzu).
